activities: Ryley Carlock and Applewhite’s Document Control Group, DCG, provides electronic discovery readiness and response services to corporations and the law firms that represent them.  The company’s readiness approach, consulting with corporations to assess and improve business processes, addresses business practices that can be changed to drive down discovery costs and risks.  The supporting response services deliver accurate, comprehensive document review and production solutions to corporations facing litigation or investigation.  Ryley Carlock and Applewhite provides electronic evidence consulting, collection, processing and analytical services to lawyers, law firms and corporations in connection with pending or contemplated claims or litigation. This work encompasses inspection, collection and receipt of personal information, including sensitive and confidential human resources data, from EU sources as well as transmission or transport of that data into the United States for processing, forensic analysis and presentation as evidence in legal proceedings.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
